line.text: How sweet and lovely dost thou make the shame
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Which like a canker in the fragrant rose
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Doth spot the beauty of thy budding name
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: O in what sweets dost thou thy sins enclose
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: That tongue that tells the story of thy days
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*
s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Cannot dispraise but in a kind of praise
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Naming thy name blesses an ill report
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: O what a mansion have those vices got
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Which for their habitation chose out thee
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Where beauty veil doth cover every blot
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: And all things turns to fair that eyes can see
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Take heed (dear heart) of this large privilege
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: The hardest knife ill-used doth lose his edge
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*
